textValues.string: H1 (for first text component on a page)
This is the introduction text that introduces the section. Not to be confused with General information that is a subsection of the information strucutre

component.title: SNL plummer block housings, series 2, 3, 5 and 6

textValues.string: SNL plummer block housings, series 2, 3, 5 and 6

SNL plummer (pillow) block housings up to size 32 are the most popular of the wide range of SKF housings. Because of their versatility it is seldom necessary to resort to tailored housings for specific applications.

The housings are horizontally split and have two or four attachment bolt holes in the base as standard.

Building block system
The basis of the SNL plummer block housing system consists of a number of housings of the same design but in different sizes. By combining these housings with different standard seals a wide variety of housing variants, all belonging to the standard range, can be supplied (fig). SNL plummer blocks can accommodate shaft diameters ranging from 20 to 160 mm.

Reinforced base
The housing base is reinforced with ribs and extra material surrounding the holes for the attachment bolts in order to improve seating on the base plate (fig). The attachment bolts can be preloaded to give better location and cannot deform the housing base or housing bore.

Attachment
SNL housings have two attachment bolt holes in the base as standard. Housings of size 511-609 and larger are also available with four cast attachment bolt holes as standard, designated FSNL. These larger housings are also available without attachment bolt holes (blank base, designated SSNLD), but only made of ductile cast iron.

Also the smaller housings below size 511-609 can be used for four bolt mounting. Cast indications show where to drill the additional holes.

Good heat conduction
The extra ribs the housing base (fig) provide additional surface area between the base and base plate to improve heat flow away from the bearing.

Relubrication facility
SNL housings are supplied with a grease nipple. Two tapped holes for the nipple in the cap are standard. Cast indications mark other grease nipple locations for relubrication of the bearing or the seals (fig).

Caps and bases individually marked
The housing base and cap are matched during manufacture and are not interchangeable. To prevent mixing, the same consecutive number is marked on the cap and base of each individual housing (fig).

Mounting aid
To simplify mounting and make alignment more accurate, cast indications in the end faces of the housing base indicate the housing bore axis and the vertical axis (fig)

Mounting instructions are also supplied with each housing.

Indications for holes to accommodate other components
Cast indications mark the positions where holes can be drilled for dowel pins, sensors for condition monitoring and additional grease nipples (fig).

Large SNL plummer block housings (fig) are the standard housings for shaft diameters from 115 mm and above. The housings are horizontally split and have four attachment bolt holes in the base. They have two eyebolts on the cap to facilitate handling.

Choice of seals
There is a choice of two standard seals for each housing and other special seals can be incorporated (fig). End covers are also available.

Reinforced base
The housing base is reinforced with ribs and extra material surrounding the four holes for the attachment bolts in order to improve seating on the base plate. The attachment bolts can be preloaded to give better location and cannot deform the housing base or housing bore (fig).

Good heat conduction
The reinforcement of the housing base means that there is a considerable area of contact between the base and base plate making for improved heat flow away from the bearing (fig).

Relubrication facility
The large SNL housings have three drilled and tapped holes that are plugged by metal screws. Two of the holes are in the housing cap (fig) and one is in the side face. Two grease nipples with covers as well as one adapter with G 1/8 and G 1/4 threads are supplied with each housing. Dimples cast into the cap mark the positions for grease nipples if it is required to relubricate the seals.

Space for sensor connections
Flat areas offer space to accommodate sensors for condition monitoring (fig). Housings with tapped holes can be supplied to order.

Caps and bases individually marked
The housing base and cap are matched during manufacture and are not interchangeable with those of other housings. To prevent mixing, the same consecutive number is marked on the cap and base of each individual housing (fig).

Easy mounting
Cap bolts are easy to unscrew. Notches to pry the cap from the base ease cap removal. The rectangular base and centring marks that are vertical to the housing bore axis simplify alignment (fig). Dimples mark the positions for dowels.

Mounting instructions are also supplied with each housing.

SDG plummer block housings have been developed for large bearing arrangements. These split housings can be used for

–spherical roller bearings and CARB bearings in several dimension series.

The housings are designed for bearing arrangement types

–bearing on adapter sleeve and smooth shafts with 125 to 530 mm diameter
–bearing on adapter sleeve and stepped shafts with cylindrical seats with 125 to 530 mm diameter
–bearing on withdrawal sleeve and stepped shafts with cylindrical seats with 135 to 600 mm diameter
–bearing on stepped shafts with cylindrical seats with 140 to 710 mm diameter.

Seals
–Felt seals
–Felt seals with additional V-ring
–Labyrinth seals with inner felt seal

Lubrication
–Grease lubrication

Materials
–Grey cast iron
–Spheroidal graphite cast iron
–Cast steel

For more information see SKF catalogue 4005 "Bearing housings".

SONL plummer block housings (fig) which replace the former SOFN housings, are intended for oil lubrication. These housings are designed for bearings operating at high speeds and at high temperatures. Primary applications include fans, flywheels and emergency power installations.

If an SONL size is not available, an SOFN housing can be supplied instead. Check with SKF for availability.

SONL plummer block housings were designed in accordance with customer requests using experience from SOFN and SNL housings. Advantages include:

Effective seals
In tough laboratory tests and real-life applications, the seals have proven extremely tight. The oil stays in and dirt is kept out of the housings.

Superior bearing lubrication
–The housings have a deep reservoir that holds a large volume of oil enabling low oil temperatures and long service intervals.
–In addition, cooling elements to help control the oil bath temperature are available (fig).
–The inside oil pick-up ring provides an active flow in the housing (fig).
–Oil level marks in the housing and an oil level gauge help to keep the correct oil level.
–A magnetic plug attracts metal particles that might reduce bearing life.

Easy mounting
–SONL housings have a reduced number of components (fig).
–The housings are easy to align: The housing base is square and cast markings on the side faces show the centre of the housing bore (fig).
–The cap bolts between the housing halves are delivered "finger-tight" for easy removal.
–An eyebolt in the cap eases handling.

SAF pillow (plummer) blocks (fig) are the SKF standard housings for inch shafts. Because of their versatility it is seldom necessary to resort to tailored housings for specific applications. They are typically supplied as kits together with a bearing and an adapter sleeve, but all parts are also available separately.

The housings are horizontally split and have two or four bolt holes in the base, depending on the housing size.

SAF housings are available in two designs. Housing sizes from 507 to 528 and 211 to 228 use a new casting design similar to SKF housings in the SNL series (fig). Other sizes are manufactured in the previous casting design (fig). SAF housings from SKF combine a lot of advantages:

Designed for long bearing service life
SAF housings contribute to long bearing service life:

–A proper machined bearing seat provides a suitable fit together with the appropriate SKF bearing.
–Size and grade specific cap bolts offer superior clamping force between the cap and base.
–Effective seals protect the bearing from contamination and keep the lubricant in.
–Lubrication features enable frequent relubrication if necessary.

Designed for demanding applications
SAF housings are designed for heavy-duty operation in conveyors, mining, papermaking equipment as well as lighter duty and high speed service in fans, blowers and other applications:

–Flat surfaces on the cap accommodate condition monitoring attachments and other application specific fittings.
–A large choice of seals meet nearly all application requirements.

Designed for easy mounting
SAF housings ease installation:

–A flat square foot helps to accurately align the housing.
–Cast-in dimples locate dowel holes or vents during field installation.
–Dowels locate the cap and base for correct assembly.
–Pry slots make it easy to remove the cap for bearing installation and maintenance.
–Housing sizes from 507 to 528 and 211 to 228 offer further helpful features like cast in grease fill lines inside the base and cast in centreline marks on the base for easy alignment.

SDAF pillow (plummer) block housings were specially designed for applications with inch size shafts where heavy thrust loads and/or shock loads require a housing of exceptionally sturdy construction. The split housings can be used for

–spherical roller bearings as well as
–CARB bearings.

The housings are designed for bearing arrangement types

–bearing on adapter sleeve and smooth shafts with 215/16 to 191/2 inch diameter
and
–bearing on stepped inch shafts and cylindrical seats (metric) with 85 to 530 mm diameter.

Seals
–Labyrinth seals
–Labyrinth seals with inner radial shaft seal
–Radial shaft seal
–Taconite heavy-duty seals

Lubrication
–Grease lubrication
–Oil lubrication

Materials
–Grey cast iron
–Cast steel

For more information see SKF catalogue "Mounted Products".

SAW split pillow (plummer) block housings are designed to accommodate the higher capacity 232 series spherical roller bearings. They can also be used with 222 series bearings to allow for greater axial travel or thermal shaft expansion.

SAW blocks have the same basic mounting dimensions as their SAF counterparts but are about one inch wider to accommodate the wider bearing. Shaft sizes range from 37/16 in to 715/16 in in adapter mounting.

SAW blocks are available in four-bolt base only and are suitable for grease or oil lubrication.

LER/LOR triple ring seals are standard but, as with the SAF, other sealing options are available.
